title: [bug] Sidecar binary doesn't work for `tauri dev` once it's been changed
body:
### Describe the bug

The dev flow with a python binary as a sidecar gets interrupted after making any changes to the sidecar. I'm on an ARM Mac (M1 Air).
I've created a repo with info and easy reproduction steps in the readme: https://github.com/SamLewis0602/tauri-repro

### Reproduction

### To reproduce

1. Clone https://github.com/SamLewis0602/tauri-repro
1. Use pyinstaller to build `simple.py` (`pyinstaller -F simple.py`)
1. Place binary in src-tauri/bin
1. Append target triple (I'm on ARM mac so left my binary in there)
1. Run `yarn tauri dev`, see app for command output
1. Make any change to `simple.py` (change printed text or whatever)
1. Repeat steps 3-5
1. See that sidecar fails with signal 9


### Expected behavior

To be able to change the sidecar binary itself and still have it run in `yarn tauri dev`

### Platform and versions

```shell
$ tauri info

Environment
  › OS: Mac OS 12.3.0 X64
  › Node.js: 16.13.1
  › npm: 8.1.2
  › pnpm: Not installed!
  › yarn: 1.22.18
  › rustup: 1.24.3
  › rustc: 1.60.0
  › cargo: 1.60.0
  › Rust toolchain: stable-aarch64-apple-darwin 

Packages
  › @tauri-apps/cli [NPM]: 1.0.0-rc.10
  › @tauri-apps/api [NPM]: 1.0.0-rc.5
  › tauri [RUST]: 1.0.0-rc.10,
  › tauri-build [RUST]: 1.0.0-rc.8,
  › tao [RUST]: 0.8.4,
  › wry [RUST]: 0.16.2,

App
  › build-type: bundle
  › CSP: unset
  › distDir: ../dist
  › devPath: ../dist

App directory structure
  ├─ dist
  ├─ node_modules
  ├─ src-tauri
  └─ .git
✨  Done in 6.68s.
```


### Stack trace

_No response_

### Additional context

Note:

- The binary still works normally when called from the terminal
- The sidecar works in the prod build `yarn tauri build`
- The sidecar only fails in dev `yarn tauri dev`

If I reboot my computer the binary will work again without changing the binary at all. It makes me wonder if it's somehow related to signing the binary? Thanks for any help.
